bibl.title: φιλοτιμία in Byzantine Papyrus Documents.
bibl.note: In sixth-century financial documents, φιλοτιμία means a fund of staple commodities or of money, out of which disbursements were made to professionals or craftsmen as honoraria for services rendered.
bibl.seg: MacCOULL Leslie S.B., φιλοτιμία in Byzantine Papyrus Documents.
In sixth-century financial documents, φιλοτιμία means a fund of staple commodities or of money, out of which disbursements were made to professionals or craftsmen as honoraria for services rendered.
